Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Stereotactic Radiosurgery in Facilitating Microsurgical Resection of Brain Arteriovenous Malformations

Trial_Design.evidence: A total of 42 patients with AVMs were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted at the University of California, San Francisco, from 1997 to 2007. A total of 42 patients with AVMs

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either prior RS (RS+) or no RS (RSâˆ’) before microsurgical resection

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in modified Rankin Scale (mRS) scores, assessed postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: Twenty-one patients were randomised to each group

Result_Outcome.evidence: mean AVM volume was reduced by 78% (P<0.01), and Spetzler-Martin grades decreased in 52% of patients (P<0.001)

Harms.evidence: RS+ patients experienced deterioration due to hemorrhages during the latency period (P<0.05)
